title: Lida93
author: Lida93
content: El Salvador government is at  it again after the country had adopted bitcoin as a legal tender in June of 2021 as one of the first country to take such bold step.Quote The Ministry of Education in El Salvador partnered with Mi Primer Bitcoin (MPB), a nonprofit educational organization, to make Bitcoin-related content part of the school curriculum in the country. The pilot program will train 150 teachers to impart Bitcoin education, bringing the program to 75 public schools. Source:The El Salvador government has again I'm the bid to promote bitcoin adoption draft out a plan of teaching about 150 teachers from 7 different schools who will in turn teaching school students about the basics of  bitcoin and it's related content. And if the project gains success as expected the bitcoin public education it's going to be spread in all schools all over the country.This action in my opinion is made necessary to bridge the  knowledge gap about bitcoin among the future generations of El Salvador. If other governments follow the path of El Salvador as a nation it won't be long the campaign for a widespread bitcoin adoption will be achieved.What do you all think about the methodology of adoption the El Salvador government is using to shovel bitcoin knowledge to every home through school students?Will the goal be attainable and what does this mean for your own country?Discussions are invited.

comments.body: Quote from: Lida93 on September 07, 2023, 11:42:06 PMEl Salvador's government is at it again after the country adopted bitcoin as a legal tender in June of 2021 as one of the first countries to take such a bold step.Quote The Ministry of Education in El Salvador partnered with Mi Primer Bitcoin (MPB), a nonprofit educational organization, to make Bitcoin-related content part of the school curriculum in the country. The pilot program will train 150 teachers to impart Bitcoin education, bringing the program to 75 public schools. Source:The El Salvador government has again made a bid to promote Bitcoin adoption and drafted out a plan of teaching about 150 teachers from 7 different schools who will in turn teach school students about the basics of itcoin and its related content. And if the project gains success as expected Bitcoin public education it's going to be spread in all schools all over the country.This action in my opinion is necessary to bridge the knowledge gap about bitcoin among the future generations of El Salvador. If other governments follow the path of El Salvador as a nation it won't be long before the campaign for widespread bitcoin adoption will be achieved.What do you all think about the methodology of adoption the El Salvador government is using to shovel Bitcoin knowledge to every home through school students?Will the goal be attainable and what does this mean for your own country?Discussions are invited.This method initiated by the El Salvador government to train 150 teachers that we teach students in various schools in El Salvador will create more understanding of Bitcoin to the citizens of El Salvador and also increase Bitcoin adoption in El Salvador. This idea will serve as a means of employment and also increase the acceptance of Bitcoin as payment in El Salvador. Only the news of this will have a positive impact on Bitcoin and the crypto market at large.

comments.body: Quote from: Lida93 on September 07, 2023, 11:42:06 PM~snip~What do you all think about the methodology of adoption the El Salvador government is using to shovel bitcoin knowledge to every home through school students?Will the goal be attainable and what does this mean for your own country?As for the school program, I'm not surprised that the authorities are going in that direction, because they obviously realized that the only way to attract more people to Bitcoin is to start with the young population. What doesn't make sense is that you think that other governments in the world will go in the same direction just because El Salvador did it.Imagine the situation if the US, the UK or the EU declare Bitcoin legal tender and start telling everyone to use it instead of national currencies. El Salvador replaced their national currency with $ 20+ years ago, so they are in a specific situation where they can experiment with Bitcoin.Given that there is a main topic about El Salvador in the Bitcoin Discussion, I wonder why there is a new topic at all and why in Beginners & Help?

So many benefits will be achieved by El Salvador citizens from bitcoin and it blockchain. El Salvador wants to use bitcoin to step out from poor economy in the nearest future.

comments.author: Fiatless
comments.body: Quote from: Lida93 on September 07, 2023, 11:42:06 PM Source:This should be the correct link:https://news.bitcoin.com/el-salvador-launches-pilot-project-to-include-bitcoin-content-in-school-curriculums/QuoteDiscussions are invited.I tried to check the content of the curriculum but I couldn't find any of the documents. But it is obvious that these students will be introduced to the basics of bitcoin like wallets, transactions, security, etc. And it also seems like the target is high school students which is okay. Teaching children who are less than twelve years old might not be the right decision because they might not understand the concept. There is also a report that participants are given a diploma certificate that is nationally recognized. An undiluted Bitcoin education is needed globally. People need to know about Bitcoin and its benefits to individuals, businesses, and institutions. So it's great news to know that over 25,000 students have learned about bitcoin in El Salvador and this awareness is moving to other Latin American countries like Uruguay and Cuba. All of these students might not embrace Bitcoin but the few that accept it will spread the good news.
